text: Lower Allithwaite is a civil parish in the South Lakeland district of the English county of Cumbria. It includes the villages of Allithwaite and Cartmel, the historic Cartmel Priory, Humphrey Head and Cartmel Racecourse. The parish has a population of 1,758,Office for National Statistics: Census 2001 : Parish Headcounts : South Lakeland Retrieved 26 October 2010 increasing to 1,831 at the 2011 Census. ==See also== *Listed buildings in Lower Allithwaite ==References== Category:Civil parishes in Cumbria
title: Lower Allithwaite
